subject: Business
title: The Suez Canal Blockage: A Case Study
description: A fast breakdown of The Suez Canal Blockage: A Case Study for builders.

hook.text: In 2021, one ship got stuck sideways in the Suez Canal. Global trade lost $9.6 billion per day for six days.

buildup.text: The Ever Given, one of the world's largest container ships, was wedged across the canal by wind and a navigation error.

discovery.text: 12% of global trade passes through the Suez Canal. Blocking it created a traffic jam of 400+ ships.

twist.text: The ripple effects lasted months. Ports were congested, schedules scrambled, and container shortages worsened globally.

climax.text: The lesson: one chokepoint in a global system can cascade into disruption that costs billions and lasts months.

punchline.text: The global economy can be held hostage by a single stuck ship.

quiz.question: How much trade passes through the Suez Canal?
